column4: HELP!  I just upgraded from 11.04 to 11.10 and even though I enter the correct password I cannot restart my main user session (I had to start another session to get to x-chat to post here.).  When I click on my main user name and enter my password, the screen goes black and then returns me right back to the main menu.  Please help
I can use my password on the command line, and it works, I even can reset it
Maybe three is a problem whith your home dir?
When you login via console mode, what do you see?   ls
Maybe there is a problem with the X server?
console works great. and which files might be missing? X works well for other users
I have gnome and unity installed, but I used XFCE
but my problem is the same for all sessions

Ok, go to a console session, (Ctrl-Alt-F6) and run:  tail -f /var/log/messages and then Ctrl-Alt-F7 back to GUI,  log out and try to log back in as original user.  After failure, go back to tty6 ( Ctrl-ALt-F6 ) and see what clues there may be.
Look at the user's files and see that permissions are correct.  ls -l /home/user1
What is the name of the original user?
